definition: noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
clock/o'clock/time as measured in hours and minutes/bell/CL:架[jia4],座[zuo4]
handleless cup/goblet/to concentrate/variant of 鐘|钟[zhong1]

sentences.english: What time shall I set the alarm (clock) for?
sentences.chinese: 我该把闹钟拨到几点钟响？

sentences.english: This is a clock radio with alarm.
sentences.chinese: 这是个带闹钟功能的钟控收音机。

sentences.english: Then have the alarm set about 30 minutes after the suns fully up.
sentences.chinese: 然后，将闹钟定到太阳完全升起后约30分钟的时刻。

sentences.english: If you don't set your alarm clock, you'll oversleep.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不设闹钟，就会睡过头。

sentences.english: He is afraid of waking up late, so he always has an alarm on his bedside table.
sentences.chinese: 他怕睡过头，总是在床头小几上放一个闹钟。

sentences.english: Star Wars themed alarm clock will project the time on your wall.
sentences.chinese: 这款星球大战主题闹钟会把时间投影到你的墙上。

sentences.english: An early morning alarm gets my daughter, Morgan, up for summer school.
sentences.chinese: 一大早闹钟铃响就闹醒女儿茉苷去上暑期学校。

sentences.english: To snooze you just hit the top of the clock.
sentences.chinese: 为了启动贪睡模式你只需轻拍闹钟顶部。

sentences.english: Your satellite-enabled alarm clock goes off.
sentences.chinese: 你的由卫星激活的闹钟响了。

sentences.english: A: I think you know already that I want to discuss the representa- tion for your alarm clocks.
sentences.chinese: 想必你已知道，我想和你商谈你方闹钟的代理问题。

sentences.english: On the right of the secretaire is a bookshelf.
sentences.chinese: 上面有一个小白兔闹钟。

sentences.english: Thi innovative alaram clock is composed by a micro vibration device and a micro-chip.
sentences.chinese: 这款新颖的闹钟由微振动装置和微型芯片组成。

sentences.english: LEGO Minifig alarm clocks shaped like Star Wars characters.
sentences.chinese: 乐高按照星球大战人物造型制作的人仔闹钟。

sentences.english: Martin set his alarm, drew up to the table, and opened Fiske.
sentences.chinese: 马丁上好闹钟，坐到桌边，打开了费斯克。

sentences.english: The child has bust up the alarm clock.
It's six forty in the morning. The alarm is ringing, and Enn gets up.
sentences.chinese: 早上六点四十分，闹钟响了，小英起床了。

definition: to get out of bed/to get up
to awaken/to wake sb up/to rouse
to have a lie-in/to dawdle in bed
to give sb a wake-up call (at a hotel)
to wake sb up with a noise
